indicator_name: Proportion of local governments that adopt and implement local disaster risk reduction strategies in line with national disaster risk reduction strategies
page_content:
**Non-statistical indicator**

We have identified the following laws, policies and strategy plans in place that are relevant to this indicator -

[Merseyside Prepared](https://www.merseysideprepared.org.uk/) - The Merseyside Resilience Forum (MRF) is a multi-agency partnership made up of all the organisations needed to prepare for and respond to any emergency in the county. It was started in 2005 after the Government issued a law called the Civil Contingencies Act.

[Merseyside Community Risk Register 2020](https://liverpool.gov.uk/media/9081/2020-merseyside-community-risk-register.pdf) - The Community Risk Register (CRR) has been compiled by the Merseyside Resilience Forum (MRF) to identify potential risks that may affect the communities of Merseyside.
